    • Method Detail

      • open

        public static Index open(String indexPath)
        Create a new bare Git index object as a memory representation of the Git index file in 'indexPath', without a repository to back it.

        Since there is no ODB or working directory behind this index, any Index methods which rely on these (e.g. index_add_bypath) will fail with the GIT_ERROR error code.

        If you need to access the index of an actual repository, use the `git_repository_index` wrapper.

        The index must be freed once it's no longer in use.

        Parameters:
        indexPath - the path to the index file in disk
        Returns:
        the pointer for the new index
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • close

        public void close()
        Delegate git_index_free Free an existing index object.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • owner

        public Repository owner()
        Get the repository this index relates to
        Returns:
        the repository that owns the index

      • caps

        public EnumSet<Index.Capability> caps()
        Read index capabilities flags.
        Returns:
        A combination of Capability enums

      • setCaps

        public void setCaps(EnumSet<Index.Capability> caps)
        Set index capabilities flags.

        If you pass `GIT_INDEX_CAPABILITY_FROM_OWNER` for the caps, then capabilities will be read from the config of the owner object, looking at `core.ignorecase`, `core.filemode`, `core.symlinks`.

        Parameters:
        caps - A combination of Index.Capability values
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • version

        public int version()
        Get index on-disk version.

        Valid return values are 2, 3, or 4. If 3 is returned, an index with version 2 may be written instead, if the extension data in version 3 is not necessary.

        Returns:
        the index version

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(int version)
        Set index on-disk version.

        Valid values are 2, 3, or 4. If 2 is given, git_index_write may write an index with version 3 instead, if necessary to accurately represent the index.

        Parameters:
        version - The new version number
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • read

        public void read(boolean force)
        Update the contents of an existing index object in memory by reading from the hard disk.

        If `force` is true, this performs a "hard" read that discards in-memory changes and always reloads the on-disk index data. If there is no on-disk version, the index will be cleared.

        If `force` is false, this does a "soft" read that reloads the index data from disk only if it has changed since the last time it was loaded. Purely in-memory index data will be untouched. Be aware: if there are changes on disk, unwritten in-memory changes are discarded.

        Parameters:
        force - if true, always reload, vs. only read if file has changed
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • write

        public void write()
        Write an existing index object from memory back to disk using an atomic file lock.
        Throws:
        GitException - git error.

      • path

        public String path()

      • checksum

        public Oid checksum()
        Get the checksum of the index

        This checksum is the SHA-1 hash over the index file (except the last 20 bytes which are the checksum itself). In cases where the index does not exist on-disk, it will be zeroed out.

        Returns:
        the checksum of the index

      • readTree

        public void readTree(Tree tree)
        Read a tree into the index file with stats, roughly equals to: 
             git read-tree []
        The current index contents will be replaced by the specified tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - tree to read
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • writeTree

        public Oid writeTree()
        Write the index as a tree, roughly equals to: 
             git write-tree

        This method will scan the index and write a representation of its current state back to disk; it recursively creates tree objects for each of the subtrees stored in the index, but only returns the OID of the root tree. This is the OID that can be used e.g. to create a commit.

        The index instance cannot be bare, and needs to be associated to an existing repository.

        The index must not contain any file in conflict.

        Returns:
        Oid of the tree
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors, for example GIT_EUNMERGED when the index is not clean or an error code

      • writeTreeTo

        public Oid writeTreeTo(Repository repo)
        Write the index as a tree to the given repository

        This method will do the same as `git_index_write_tree`, but letting the user choose the repository where the tree will be written.

        The index must not contain any file in conflict.

        Parameters:
        repo - Repository where to write the tree
        Returns:
        oid of the tree written
        Throws:
        GitException - git error like GIT_EUNMERGED when the index is not clean

      • entryCount

        public int entryCount()
        Get the count of entries currently in the index, roughly equals to: 
             $ git ls-files | wc -l
        Returns:
        integer of count of current entries

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the contents (all the entries) of an index object.

        This clears the index object in memory; changes must be explicitly written to disk for them to take effect persistently.

        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • addFromBuffer

        public void addFromBuffer(Index.Entry entry,
                          byte[] buffer)
        Add or update an index entry from a buffer in memory

        This method will create a blob in the repository that owns the index and then add the index entry to the index. The `path` of the entry represents the position of the blob relative to the repository's root folder.

        If a previous index entry exists that has the same path as the given 'entry', it will be replaced. Otherwise, the 'entry' will be added. The `id` and the `file_size` of the 'entry' are updated with the real value of the blob.

        This forces the file to be added to the index, not looking at gitignore rules. Those rules can be evaluated through the git_status APIs (in status.h) before calling this.

        If this file currently is the result of a merge conflict, this file will no longer be marked as conflicting. The data about the conflict will be moved to the "resolve undo" (REUC) section.

        Parameters:
        entry - filename to add
        buffer - data to be written into the blob
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • removeByPath

        public void removeByPath(String path)
        Remove an index entry corresponding to a file on disk

        The file `path` must be relative to the repository's working folder. It may exist.

        If this file currently is the result of a merge conflict, this file will no longer be marked as conflicting. The data about the conflict will be moved to the "resolve undo" (REUC) section.

        Parameters:
        path - filename to remove
        Throws:
        GitException - git erros

      • add

        public void add(String path)
        Add or update an index entry from a file on disk
        Parameters:
        path - filename to add
        Throws:
        GitException - git error

      • addAll

        public void addAll(String[] pathSpec,
                   EnumSet<Index.AddOption> flags,
                   BiConsumer<String,String> callback)
        Add or update index entries matching files in the working directory.
        Parameters:
        pathSpec - array of path patterns
        flags - combination of git_index_add_option_t flags
        callback - notification callback for each added/updated path (also gets index of matching pathspec entry); can be NULL; return 0 to add, >0 to skip, < 0 to abort scan.
        Throws:
        GitException - git error

      • updateAll

        public void updateAll(List<String> pathSpec,
                      Index.Callback callback)
        Update all index entries, which have already been included and match the pathSpec pattern), to line up with the working directory. 
          # show which files are included in existing index,
  $ git ls-files --cached
  # make a trivial change to one of the file, say "README.md"
  $ echo "" >> README.md
  # update the index: `updateAll(List.of("README.md", (path, pathSpec)-> {})`
  $ git update-index README.md
 
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        pathSpec - array of path patterns
        

        callback - notification callback for each updated path (also gets index of matching
     pathspec entry); can be NULL; return 0 to add, >0 to skip, < 0 to abort scan.
        

        Throws:
        

        GitException - git error.

        find
        

        public int find(String path)
        

        Find the first position of any entries which point to given path in the Git index.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        path - path to search
        

        Returns:
        

        a zero-based position in the index if found; GIT_ENOTFOUND otherwise
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        findPrefix
        

        public int findPrefix(String prefix)
        

        Find the first position of any entries matching a prefix. To find the first position of a
 path inside a given folder, suffix the prefix with a '/'.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        prefix - the prefix to search for
        

        Returns:
        

        0 with valid value in at_pos;
        

        Throws:
        

        GitException - git errors like GIT_ENOTFOUND
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        conflictAdd
        

        public void conflictAdd(Index.Conflict conflict)
        

        Add or update index entries to represent a conflict. Any staged entries that exist at the
 given paths will be removed.

 
        The entries are the entries from the tree included in the merge. Any entry may be null to
 indicate that that file was not present in the trees during the merge. For example,
 ancestor_entry may be NULL to indicate that a file was added in both branches and must be
 resolved.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        conflict - a set of entry that represents a conflict
        

        Throws:
        

        GitException - git errors
        

        

        • 

      




        

      •

        public void conflictRemove(String path)
        

        Removes the index entries that represent a conflict of a single file.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        path - path to remove conflicts for
        

        Throws:
        

        GitException - git errors
